name: artifacts of anatolia - 02: kayaköy/levissi
description: /part of "artifacts of anatolia" series/ // specs: 4989x2806 pixels - PNG // Kayaköy/Levissi is an old Greek village located in Fethiye/Muğla (Turkey) that lost it's folks due to a "people exchange", which was a part of a treaty between Turkey and Greece in 1923. then it's been shaped by loneliness and earthquakes throughout these years. it's a very emotional subject that people being forced to disconnect from their homeland but still, it's also a hauntingly beautiful thing to observe the nature taking back a piece land and expand.
